message:
Venu has written a blog post on how he got introduced to KWoC.

We appreciate and encourage people to spread the word about Kharagpur Winter of Code so that even your friends and many more people benefit from this program!

The countdown is over! Kharagpur Winter of Code is now taking student registrations.

https://kwoc.kossiitkgp.in

KWoC is a December long online program. For those who already know about Google Summer of Code, KWoC is going to be very helpful for you. Register yourself as a student and the instructions will follow you. For those who don't know about such open source programs, KWoC is a platform where you are going to learn about a new style of collaborative software development. Read more on the website.

In simple steps:
- Register yourself.
- Go through the projects.
- Choose one/two you want to work on.
- Contact the mentor of the project.
- Contribute !

Feel free to reach us anytime.

With ❤️
- KOSS

story: Kharagpur Open Source Society - KOSS shared Metakgp's post.
message: Kharagpur Open Source Society - KOSS shared Metakgp's post. Kharagpur Winter of Code has been announced for one more time. Started last year, it is a program to introduce new students to free and open-source softwares. This has also helps college students prepare for Google Summer of Code, to be held in March. For mentors : Do you maintain project(s) which needs students' contribution? Or are you a collaborator of any open source software? Let us together introduce more students to the world of open source ! Register your projects on https://kwoc.kossiitkgp.in For students : Student registrations will start soon. Please stay tuned with Kharagpur Open Source Society - KOSS https://wiki.metakgp.org/w/Kharagpur_Winter_of_Code

We are happy to announce that we are hosting Kharagpur Winter of Code (KWoC) 2017, in association with Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur, this December to help students (it doesn't matter who you are as long as you are willing to learn) make their first real contributions to open source projects. We also invite enthusiastic mentors from all places to guide and share their knowledge and help students.

This is kind of a mock GSoC program tailored for beginners.

Mentors can register their projects on our official KWoC website http://kwoc.kossiitkgp.in/

story: Kharagpur Open Source Society - KOSS added 4 new photos.
message:
Recently, we conducted a workshop at Nalanda, where we taught students the importance of Version Control System, and the usage of Git and Github. We also taught how to contribute to someone else's projects.

To revise the workshop:
1. Introduction to linux command line - Udacity (https://in.udacity.com/course/linux-command-line-basics--ud595)
2. Git and GitHub - Udacity (https://in.udacity.com/course/how-to-use-git-and-github--ud775)

To learn more than was taught in the workshop specifically about viewing older versions, modifying histories and many more tools like that:
1. Git atlassian tutorial (https://www.atlassian.com/git/tutorials)
2. Git-scm (https://git-scm.com/book/en/v2)  
3. Git Interactive Practice(https://learngitbranching.js.org/)

Also, here are a few glimpses from the workshop!

Kharagpur Open Source Society is conducting another workshop on Git and Github.

Time: 3.30 PM
Venue: NR122
Date: 15th October 2017 (Sunday)

In this workshop, we will teach you the basics of Git as a version control software and we will tell you how to actually contribute to projects on Github. There will be a hands-on session too, where you will learn to actually contribute to real software.

This will be a very crucial workshop for participating in Kharagpur Winter of Code which is coming soon :)

P.S. : Everyone should bring their laptops!

story: Kharagpur Open Source Society - KOSS added an event.
message:
Ubuntu Install Fest
Date: 02:00PM
Time: 02-09-2017
Veunu: Kharagpur Open Source Society - KOSS

Kharagpur Open Source Society is organizing the Ubuntu Install Fest, an opportunity to get Linux installed on your PC.

Date:   2nd September 2017
Time:   2 PM
Venue: Room 120, CSE Department

Bring out the open source geek in you by switching to Linux as a standalone OS, or get it dual booted alongside Windows.

  We'll also discuss any doubts which you may have in Python just after the fest.

Note: Please download a copy of Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (https://www.ubuntu.com/download/desktop/thank-you?country=IN&version=16.04.3&architecture=amd64). Backup all your important files and don't forget to bring a pendrive along with your laptop. Ensure there is around 100 GB free space on your PC. Make sure your laptop is fully charged for the installation to complete smoothly.
Dual boot instructions: https://wiki.metakgp.org/w/How_to_install_Ubuntu_as_Dual_Boot
PS: If you can't download Ubuntu or bring a pendrive with you, just come with your laptop, we'll have few spare pendrives.

story: Kharagpur Open Source Society - KOSS shared Career Development Centre, IIT Kharagpur's post.
message: Kharagpur Open Source Society - KOSS shared Career Development Centre, IIT Kharagpur's post. #AnalyzeThis2017 goes live on August 20, 2017 at 10 am Winners and top performers from each campus win a direct PPI with American Express and prizes worth INR 2,50,000 ! 1st Prize : I-pad 2nd Prize : GoPro Camera 3rd Prize : Bluetooth Speaker And many more… It is time to put on your thinking hats! Haven’t registered yet? Do it now at https://in.axpcampus.com/AnalyzeThis/

story: Kharagpur Open Source Society - KOSS shared a group.
message: Kharagpur Open Source Society - KOSS shared a group. We have made a group for our python classes so that you all can post your doubts, interact with mentors, other students and help yourself in learning python. We strongly believe that a healthy interaction is necessary in the learning process and thus we encourage you to keep posting there. We will be posting important details regarding our classes on the group so make sure you follow it and be updated.

story: Kharagpur Open Source Society - KOSS added an event.
message:
KOSS brings to you its series of Python Classes, an effort to bring out the developer in you. Learn how to code in Python, by starting from the basics, and having a proper hands-one experience in building software. No prior experience in programming is required. As long as you are enthusiastic enough to learn, things will go smooth! ;)
Date: 03:30PM
Time: 19-08-2017
Veunu: Kharagpur Open Source Society - KOSS

story: Kharagpur Open Source Society - KOSS added an event.
message:
KOSS brings to you its series of Python Classes, an effort to bring out the developer in you. Learn how to code in Python, by starting from the basics, and having a proper hands-one experience in building software. No prior experience in programming is required. As long as you are enthusiastic enough to learn, things will go smooth! ;)
Date: 03:30PM
Time: 19-08-2017
Veunu: Kharagpur Open Source Society - KOSS

"Everyone should learn how to program a computer, because it teaches you how to think." - Steve Jobs ;)

Like every other semester, let's once again dive into the world of learning something new. This time, KOSS brings to you its series of Python Classes, an effort to bring out the developer in you. Learn how to code in Python, by starting from the basics, and having a proper hands-on experience in building software. No prior experience in programming is required. As long as you are enthusiastic enough to learn, things will go smooth! ;)

Fill up this form [1], if you are interested in attending the classes. Everyone should have their laptops (fully charged, since providing power supply won't be possible), and have Python installed on them. You can download Python from here [2]. More resources will be mailed to you, once you have filled up the form.

See you all!

Venue: CS 120, CS Department
Time: 3:30 pm - 5:30 pm
Date: Saturday, 19th Aug

[1]: https://tinyurl.com/kosspythonclasses

[2]: https://www.python.org/downloads/

"Everyone should learn how to program a computer, because it teaches you how to think." - Steve Jobs ;)

Fill up this form [1], if you are interested in attending the classes. More resources will be mailed to you, once you have filled up the form.

See you all!

[1]: https://tinyurl.com/kosspythonclasses

[2]: https://www.python.org/downloads/

Whenever Apple releases a new version of the IPhone, a vast majority of users will flock to buy the current version, although previous versions are still well in use. This particular trend is observable in may real-life scenarios , recent publications are able to improve upon previously done work and hence relay in  more citations, recent supreme court cases become famous because laws evolve and change with time. 
This dynamic evolution of networks is presented wonderfully in this video. Do give it a watch. 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fhGewF4Xyo0&feature=youtu.be

Google Summer of Code statistics are out, and we are glad to announce that we had a whopping 31 selections from IIT Kharagpur this year, which is more than double of last year.

Worldwide, IIT KGP stands 3rd in the list of number of students getting selected, after IIIT Hyderabad (39) and BITS Pilani (37). 

Moreover, India stands undefeated among having the total number of students getting selected, since last 5 years. This year, India had 569 of its applications getting selected, with US standing second (126 selections).

This clearly shows the growing trend of Open-Source development, and we strive to bring and involve more number of people into Open Source :)

For more information, visit the blog.

Google Summer of Code statistics are out, and we are glad to announce that we had a whopping 31 selections from IIT Kharagpur this year, which is more than double of last year.

Worldwide, IIT KGP stands 3rd in the list of number of students getting selected, after IIIT Hyderabad (39) and BITS Pilani (37). 

Moreover, India stands undefeated among having the total number of students getting selected, since last 5 years. This year, India had 569 of its applications getting selected, with US standing second (126 selections).

This clearly shows the growing trend of Open-Source development, and we strive to bring and involve more number of people into Open Source :)

For more information, visit the blog.

Worldwide, IIT KGP stands 3rd in the list of number of students getting selected, after IIIT Hyderabad (39) and BITS Pilani (37). 

Moreover, India stands undefeated among having the total number of students getting selected, since last 5 years. This year, India had 569 of its applications getting selected, with US standing second (126 selections).

This clearly shows the growing trend of Open-Source development, and we strive to bring and involve more number of people into Open Source :)

For more information, visit the blog.

Finally, GSoC 2017 results are out !
Congratulations to all the selected KGPians. The count from IIT Kharagpur is whopping 30 so far!

The number of selections from KGP has almost been doubling up since the past three years consecutively.

On a lighter note, KOSS congratulates 6 of its members (Mayank Jindal, Ayush Goyal, Parth Verma, Nitin Choudhary, Prathamesh Chavan, Rishabh Madan) for making it through. 

We also have Avijit, Kshitij, Nishant and Himanshu as GSoC mentors this year!

Here is the complete list : https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/10RlfMlhBwQZGxEoo9AvQ5YPYWadf0mXAAasnKiUR_rY

story: Kharagpur Open Source Society - KOSS shared Metakgp's photo.
message: Kharagpur Open Source Society - KOSS shared Metakgp's photo. We are going to have the first 2 MetaKGP Talks on April 3rd (7PM-8PM) at Maggu Room (F127, Main Building). We have two speakers: 1. Harsh Gupta (Participated in the Google Summer of Code 2014, volunteer with #SaveTheInternet Coalition) - Speaking on “Politics of Tech". The talk would be related to the speaker’s experience of working with “#SaveTheInternet” coalition that lead the pro-net neutrality campaign last year, against a proposed TRAI regulation. 2. Atal Ashutosh Agarwal (Former Vice President, Gymkhana) - Speaking on “Kgp learnings beyond Kgp's curricula”. The talk would be related to the speaker’s experience as the vice president of Gymkhana. We hope to see you there with your friends!

Metakgp is holding its first ever election for Maintainers with 7 candidates. You can read the SOPs and more about election over here :

https://wiki.metakgp.org/w/Metakgp:Governance/Election_March_2017#Candidates

If you're eligible to vote (eligibility mentioned on the wiki), you'll be getting an email by tonight. Read the SOPs, interact with them and vote.

Now that you have written an awesome software, it is probably good to make it worth reading it too. Writing good READMEs can attract more users for your open source software as well as more contributors.

One of our Executive Heads (Pranit Bauva) goes ahead to describe what makes a good README.

https://blog.kossiitkgp.in/writing-kickass-readmes-8857fbe03515#.uyrslaeri

One of our executive heads (Ayush Goyal) was bored one day during exams and decided to tear apart GitHub.

He has described the whole procedure in which he did it and its repercussions in this medium article!

https://blog.kossiitkgp.in/breaking-github-down-fa981e6286e7#.e5n7py6p1

story: Kharagpur Open Source Society - KOSS added 23 new photos to the album: GSoC Intro Seminar 2017 — with Anchit Navelkar and 6 others at Vikramshila, IIT Kharagpur.
message: We had successfully conducted an introductory workshop on GSoC wherein we had invited speakers who were selected as students as well as mentors in GSoC. They shared their experiences, benefits, tips and advice on how to participate in the open source culture! Thanks to all of the speakers (Pranit Bauva, Himanshu Mishra, Avijit Ghosh, Nishant Nikhil, Sampad Saha, Anchit Navelkar, Shivam Vats, Ayush Pandey, Harsh Gupta, Pranay Yadav, Abinash Meher) as well as those who attended!

Greetings !

We are sharing the highlights from the GSoC session yesterday for those who could not attend. This[1] is the link of our presentation.

Please join Klug on Slack[2] by inviting your self from here - https://klug-slack.herokuapp.com
Join the #gsoc channel and introduce yourself in a line or two. You can find a lot of GSoCers from KGP[3] over there, so don't hesitate.

We had mentioned about FLOSS Manuals[4] for the students. You must give this a read. It is written in a very simple and lucid manner and is one of the most useful resources for you right now.

You should also give a light read to a classic article on How to Ask Smart Questions[5]. And this is not just for GSoC !

And finally, here are a bunch of resources for you to learn Git[6], which you would be using later.

Email us or ask on KLUG slack for any help that we can provide. Do not hesitate. :)

[1] https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1c5FZLeNqGvcG4xRVK2BVI0nKAbQqCWMJrxcWBSEKR74 
[2] https://klug.slack.com 
[3] https://wiki.metakgp.org/w/Google_Summer_of_Code 
[4] http://write.flossmanuals.net/gsocstudentguide/what-is-google-summer-of-code/
[5] http://www.catb.org/~esr/faqs/smart-questions.html
[6] https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Jsun1_rU4VcK9N059NZyO3GcG9qI1LJgazoj5lSre5E

Cheers !

story: Kharagpur Open Source Society - KOSS added an event.
message:
Yes, it is that time of the year again when you have to convert coffee to code. I hope you all know that Google Summer of Code is approaching soon and the Selected Organization list is going to be published on coming Monday.
Therefore, we are planning to conduct a seminar on how to overcome the initial barrier and we will also provide you a lot of insights about GSoC program by people who have cracked GSoC before as students and as mentors. The mentors will provide you even better insights of how they select students and much more stuff.
Thus we hope to see you for the GSoC seminar on Monday, 27th February 2017 at 6.30pm Vikramshila V4.
Cheers!
Date: 06:30PM
Time: 27-02-2017
Veunu: Vikramshila, IIT Kharagpur
